location.merchant_description_html: It’s Savory vs. Sweet in a bumper to bumper battle aboard the Crisp Creperie truck. Savory lays the smackdown with salty prosciutto offset by creamy brie and topped with apple, sliced and buttered. Respect. That’s a carefully composed ingredient lineup. Can Sweet counter the move? Yes it can! Sweet brings the S’more, smothering its crepe in dark chocolate with a delicious dab of contrasting marshmallow creme. No icing needed here, graham crackers top this dessert dish. So who takes it? We turn to the new item on the menu for the verdict. Stumptown coffee, what’s it gonna be? *steam* *steam* *bubbles* Ugh, get the translator.

For treats of the frozen variety that are “made like no other,” head to Häagen-Dazs in the University District. Here you can escape the Bay rays with ruby-toned Sorbet Sippers and parfait-style ice cream Dazzlers. Looking for something uber extravagant? How about a Salted Caramel Truffle Sundae, topped with whipped cream and two chocolate-dipped pretzel sticks. Once you try it, it’ll be hard to deny it. Plus, they're the only Haagen-Dazs in Washington that makes cakes! Sweet perk! Swing by Häagen-Dazs Monday-Thursday 10AM-10PM, Fridays 10AM-11PM, Saturday 12PM-11PM and Sundays 12PM-10PM to get your fix.

Signs of an aggressive Häagen-Dazs craving: adding an umlaut to every word. #IceCreäm #Sorbët

We jaded city folk want coffee, strong and quick! But remember we must, my fellow New Yorkers, our daily morning brew comes from bitty beans. About 70 of those things go into your average cup! The folks at The Bean never lose sight of this fact as they serve coffee with love. I rely on the Americano, which I can order dirty (one shot) or filthy (two shots.) Despite the suggestive terminology, it’s totally SFW with free wifi, fifteen different sandwiches, a slew of cupcakes and a rainbow of macarons!

We jaded city folk want coffee, strong and quick! But remember we must, my fellow New Yorkers, our daily morning brew comes from bitty beans. About 70 of those things go into your average cup! The folks at The Bean never lose sight of this fact as they serve coffee with love. I rely on the Americano, which I can order dirty (one shot) or filthy (two shots.) Despite the suggestive terminology, it’s totally SFW with free wifi, fifteen different sandwiches, a slew of cupcakes and a rainbow of macarons!

Bon Me is a food truck and restaurant concept serving up bold, fresh, and fun Vietnamese cuisine to the people of Boston and Cambridge. As the name entails, Bon Me is popularly known for their spin on the classic banh mi sandwich. Those daring enough to take a step outside of the traditional are sure to be met with a tasty meal made with the freshest ingredients and striking flavors. 
  
The bright colored trucks and restaurant also serve up hearty rice bowls and zesty noodle salads that can all be customized to be vegan or vegetarian friendly. They pride themselves on making as much of their food as they can from scratch -- for you, Bon Me!

Friday, 9AM: I run into G & V Symphony Market to grab a granola bar on my way to work. 2PM: I’m crashing. I snag chips, onion dip and a 99 cent Arizona at G & V. And gum. This snack attack will yield deadly breath. 8PM: This is getting awkward. Another trip to G & V. Hoping they’ve changed shifts. Red Bull. Gummy bears. The night is young. 4AM: I’m glad they’re open 24 hours, but the shame is all-consuming. I throw on some shades and speak in a British accent to throw off the store clerk. “Great scott! This cookie ice cream sandwich is most pleasing to my drunken munchies! Cheerio!”

location.extended_address: Chicago French Market At the Ogilvie Train Station
location.merchant_description_html: Among the booths at the Chicago French Market, you’ll find something that is so very... Vietnamese. Saigon Sisters is known for incredibly crafted banh mi sandwiches. New to the banh mi scene? Start on ground level with the Classic: a crisp crusted, airy baguette packed with Vietnamese pork, American ham, French country pate and mayo. From here, the flavors only get more elaborate, like the Hen House is crammed with caramelized chicken, lemongrass and mint. If you’re not banh mi bound, dip your chopsticks into a brothy bowl of Pho, or clamp them around a fresh Spring Roll. Then, enjoy!

I miss my Italian family back in NY. Sure, the decibel level of my g-ma can be a bit much, but after a bad day at work, I knew I’d come home to tender meatballs, seeping flavor and bread crumbs. Thankfully when I moved to Chicago, I found my fix with the Getta Polpetta food truck. Wednesdays @ Clinton & Lake, Thursdays @ 57th & Ellis (U of C) and Fridays @ Hubbard & Wells. I always double check their locations on Twitter @GettaPolpetta, or else I’m crying like a lil’ baby, no meatballs in sight.

Don’t rely caffeine packed cups of coffee to power your body. There’s a more natural day-booster available! At Smoothies & More, it’s all about zeroing in on ingredients that will be a quick fix for what your body’s lacking. If you’re low on potassium, sink your straw into a chilly, blended Mango Smoothie. Bad day remedies come in the form of self-serve Edy’s yogurt. If you feel like you’re slipping up at work, we’ve got another secret for you: a ginseng packed smoothie is known to improve vitality and memory, boost the immune system and help with stress. Let’s see your cup of coffee do that!

No le tengo miedo al chile, aunque lo vea colorado. That’s Spanish for, “I’m not afraid to eat any chile, even when they look very spicy.” That’s my #1 motto when I head to Bolillo Tortas. I snag a beer, crack my knuckles and buckle down. I take down the Carne Asada Torta, a traditional Mexican sandwich boasting  strips of steak on a firm roll. Next, bacon-wrapped Stuffed Jalapenos. Scared of spice? Not me. Will I slurp up the heat-hoarding Salsa de Chipotle? You don’t even have to dare me. Motto #2: “Barriga llena. Corazón contento.” That means, “Full stomach, happy heart,” or “that meal was REAL.”

When my sister and I each order same size frozen yogurts at the same shop, one of us inevitably creates the more perfect cup. Name calling and hair pulling ensues. But now we know it’s because there is an art to the lever pull and seductive swirl that springs from the humming froyo oasis. That’s why all’s fair at Love & Yogurt, where you craft your own masterpiece of flavors and toppings and pay by weight! Sis better watch out because I make the meanest cup in Hoboken. #FroYOLO

“Bock. Bock. Bock. Bock.” The slow chant ripples through the Downtown air. As you get closer to the source, the lyrics change but the beat goes on. “Boar’s Head. Baked goods. Wine. Spirits.” Curious about what lies within Bockwinkel’s, you creep past the pack at the grocer’s entrance and hustle toward the expansive deli. “I’ll have what they’re having,” you muffle to the man behind the counter. He meets you with “a Bock special.” Unwrap. Attack. You sink your teeth into layers of jerk turkey, lush lettuce and soft cheese. The beast is worth the hype. Your eyes glaze over. Lunchtime euphoria sets in and you begin slowly, “Bock. Bock. Bock. Bock!” Bockhead transformation, complete.

I’m all about nature... as long as it’s indoors. There are too many factors outside. Weather. Shifts in the earth’s force-field. Bears. So I tend to stick with nature in a milder sense: the salad bar at Red Olive. What’s not to love about leaves of lettuce and rows of fresh vegetables? Usually, I follow that up with a dip in one of 20+ soups. When I’m ready for a wild adventure, I forgo my salad and build my own burrito. I stuff that baby with pork and really grab life by the beans. Clearly, nature DOES have a delicious side that is devoid of vicious predators and scenes from Animal Planet.

The motto at Dimo’s Pizza is, “Make love & pizza @ 3AM.” Even though their Mac & Cheese pizza is always bomb, and love is always sweet, somehow everything is better at 3AM. Dimo’s focuses on the big, the bad and the ridiculous. That means Chicago-style Hot Dog Pizzas to chow on before the game (go Cubbies!) Chicken and Waffle Pies, drizzled in maple syrup. To-die-for seasonal slices. Sound like something that you used to eat at Ian’s? You’re right! Why the name change? Dimo’s didn’t want to become a franchise. Translation: they want to keep things fresh and affordable for their customers. Hugs are in order.

“Boloco Inspired Burritos.” The phrase rattles off Bostonian tongues like the lyrics of Sweet Caroline, but what does it mean? It’s simple. Though the shop proudly serves Classic Mexican Burritos daily, many items are only Mexican in construction. But, the unique flavors--those are inspired by the people, places and ingredients of the of the Boloco community. The delicious deviations speak for themselves: The Caribbean-inspired, mango salsa’d Summer Burrito. The almighty Caesar, a salad sequence that wasn’t inspired in a day. Don’t forget the savory Bangkok Burrito. Thai your tortilla up in peanut sauce, Asian slaw and cucumbers.

Through sincere customer service, fierce flavor and a willingness to take risks, Boloco is pushing the boundaries of what a restaurant can be.
location.name: Boloco - Church Street

location.merchant_description_html:

Through sincere customer service, fierce flavor and a willingness to take risks, Boloco is pushing the boundaries of what a restaurant can be.
location.name: Boloco - Fort Eddy

location.merchant_description_html: Sushi in the SOMA? Let’s roll with it. To appease your wasabi, tempura and miso needs, I’d only send you to one place: Sushi Fantastic. Here, raw prices and fresh fish collaborate over made-to-order lunch plates. Get yours rolled and sliced from the maki menu or choose to lose the seaweed restraints with a Fantastic Bowl. The $13 namesake dish features five huge slices of maguro, a heap of salmon and a smattering of tobiko over white rice...with a side salad to boot. Whoever said raw fish can’t be filling certainly hasn’t dipped in this flavorful pool.

“The top story this hour is about an explosive epidemic in Wayland, MA where residents were spontaneously combusting due to a lack of frozen treats. But not to worry, relief is on the horizon. Danny is on the scene with more... Danny?” “That’s right Tanya, Frozen Yogurt Innovations is starting off with a self-serve bang. Swirl up your favorites... from cheesecake to strawberry to Oreo! Customers can top their towering treasures at two topping bars (one is nut free!) All creations are only 49 cents per ounce. FYI is a hero. After several sad eruptions, this story has a sweet, sweet ending. Back to you Tanya.”

At Frozen Yogurt Innovations, it is important that we provide our customers with the highest quality frozen yogurt. According to many scientific studies, eating foods rich in probiotics like Frozen Yogurt Innovations frozen yogurt may result in numerous health benefits, including improved digestive health and a stronger immune system. Each serving is full of important nutrients such as calcium and protein, as well as live and active cultures. We provide a clean and friendly atmosphere with a toppings bar fully stocked with healthy fresh fruits and delicious treats. FYI is locally owned and operated. We at Frozen Yogurt Innovations love our community and want to do our part to make it even better than we found it.

“Let me try your Som-Tum!” my friend said as I scooped up a forkful of the green papaya salad. In an instant, I was tongue-Thaied. He looked at me waiting for my answer, but I was overcome by the spice of the string bean, tomato and ground peanut medley. Maybe, if I snag a bite of something else, it’ll reverse it? He saw the look in my eyes and covered his Pineapple Rice, not willing to share if he couldn’t have a bite of mine. Time to play dirty. I faked a left-side grab, sent my chopstick through the air to pierce a Crab Rangoon before he could react. I took a bite and let out a sigh of relief. “So good.”

Gasp! We have not reviewed this place yet! No. One. Panic. Our usual snarky firestorm will be up shortly...but in the meantime, we suggest that you go rogue and check this place out anyway. Hey, maybe we can compare notes after?

Hoots, hollers and rowdy applause are directed toward to the microphone. The place is packed. The man in the spotlight unleashes a lyrical assault. Cups are raised in approval. Checkity, check yourself reader. You’re in for a Brew’d Awakening. This crowd is not sipping on gin and juice. They’re all hopped on fair trade coffee, spicy chai and frozen lemonade. There’s even someone crushing a crepe in the corner. What about the smooth performer? We can’t reveal this regular’s identity, but let’s say this: he’s the Lil’ Wayne of the Coffeehaus slam poetry world.

Peabody is on the map! The Northshore Mall is home to a shiny new Jamba Juice. The SoCal staple brings vibrantly colored smoothies, juices and parfaits to the Massachusetts masses. Get on board the fruity craze with a Strawberry Surf Rider. It’s a wave of Jamba Lemonade, a blast of lime sherbet and a generous heap of strawberries and peach pieces. Need a quick burst of nutrients? Slam a fresh squeezed Orange Carrot Banana Shot. It’s literally sunshine in a cup. Needless to say, we’re impressed California, we’re impressed.

Listen here. Be careful when you hang at The Real Deal in JP, it’s dangerously delicious and Phantom-approved. Here’s how you play it: Cash in on a Sammy “The Bull” Gravano, packed with cracked pepper turkey, muenster cheese, bacon avocado and tomato. If you want to crank up the heat, wife up a Carmela Soprano: a roasted eggplant and provolone panini, smothered in pesto mayonaise. Think you can hang with the big boys? The biggest terror on the menu is King Kong, a ½ lb. burger topped with bleu cheese, onion rings and Frank’s Red Hot. Grab some backup napkins. It’s going to be a hand to bread battle and...there will be juice.

Work is filled with cubicles and blahdy-blah meetings, so I get my kicks at lunch. My jacket and tie come off, and my “Foolhardy Foodie” t-shirt goes on. Whenever I eat at Little Thai Kitchen, I start off tame with Chili Mango Pork sauced with red chili paste. No prob. Then it gets real and people’s jaws drop... That’s right Drunken Noodle mouth, I’m jamming on Ginger Squid, sauteed with carrots, baby corn and a bit of cashew nut sauce. I hear them whisper, and to me, it sounds like jealousy. I scoop my Mango Sticky Rice with satisfaction and think to myself... you put on a great show today, Roy.

Here you are, sleepwalking your way through another morning in Suburban Station. There is only a single light that shimmers at end of the tunnel, and your goal is to approach it. The scent of strong coffee strings you along, guiding you to a sign that reads “Passero’s.” Their thick and well-caffeinated coffee is the only proper anti-venom to your morning fog. Resist the urge to settle for a watered-down cup of joe and a stale donut. Passero’s is your only ticket to clarity.

Dining in Quincy can be bittersweet. There’s no shortage of places to eat, but that many options can be overwhelming. Worse, you might pick the lemon on the block. Not to worry, Super Chef to the rescue! Once you see the drawing of the chef (and his sculpted quads) in his combination superhero-chef outfit, you’ll know you’re in good hands. Whether you’re trying to get that burger juice drip on your chin or curl up with some spicy curly fries, you’re going to find something you love in this book of a menu.

All ingredients used at Letizia’s Natural Bakery must strip before use. Products must be 100% natural! That means no artificial colors, hydrogenated oils or faux flavors. Margarine is left to melt on the sidewalk while pure, sweet butter receives the honor of being mixed into the Triple Chocolate Cloud Cake: Italian sponge cake, chocolate pastry cream and ganache. For lunch, the Eye-Talian gourmet panini sandwiches fresh genoa salami, hot capicola and mozz on a baguette. If the weather is nice, snag a Caramel Macchiato and a seat outside. But watch your step... sad margarine puddle is pouting.

Let’s start off with a toast, shall we? Lift your drinks to the lights above and repeat after me: Cheers to a menu of classic recipes, learned and eaten in Italy. To Prosecco Thursdays, filled with $5 glasses and live acoustic jazz. To spaghetti and shrimp tangled plates of Gamberoni, dancing in white wine sauce. To a place where we can assemble our own Antipasto Platters. To Enoteca Roma Ristorante, for being a Chicago dining gem, without the pretentiousness. We’ll drink to that, and when we do, there’s an extensive list of craft cocktails with our names on it.

“R” you ready to meet Ray? He’s the man behind the mysterious letter and the delicious deli counter at R Image Market. For a mere $4.50, Ray will pack you a pita with fresh falafel, spicy onions and homemade baba ghannouj. Traditional sandwich stacks take a turn for the tasty too. Savory Grilled chicken is topped with spinach, tomato and pickles on an undeniably fluffy wheat roll. Ray’s signature move? Subtly suggesting a little something special,“Wanna try that with a little bit of fresh basil?” Is that hesitation in your tone? “R” you insane? The answer is always YES.

Open daily, Sunday-Thursday 9AM-10PM and Friday-Saturday 9AM-12AM.

Brickstone Cafe, located in the Brickstone Office Park, is all for exhibitionism. We mean, straight up food flashing... they make your food right in front of you. One day you can watch as they chop and flop Lo Mein on the open grill. The next day, feast your eyes on a Gyro. If that’s not your jam, Brickstone has a host of stations: Slink over to sushi, scoop up a thin crust pizza or dive into the fresh veggie’d salad bar. The menu changes every week, but don’t worry, dessert is a mainstay.

Check out this week’s menu. They’re open from 7AM-2PM during the week.
